quest.name: Lakeland Neighbors
journal:
Regitt has the look of a dwarf with work to share.

※Please note that the difficulty of this quest has been synced to your current level. Furthermore, you may not proceed with a class or job that is different from when you accepted this quest.
Speak with the dwarven tinkerer at the Ostall Imperative.
Deliver the requested items to the dwarven tinkerer.
objectives: Speak with the dwarven tinkerer at the Ostall Imperative.
Synthesize [Error]Deliver [Error] to the dwarven tinkerer at the Ostall Imperative.

dialogue.name: REGITT
dialogue.text: As you know, we're going to need a bloody mountain of bits and pieces to make our tanks...and bugger me if those soldiers at the castle didn't kindly offer to help out.

dialogue.name: REGITT
dialogue.text: So, in exchange for them sharing their supplies, we've promised to fix up their gear and whatnot. A little give-and-take, you understand.

dialogue.name: REGITT
dialogue.text: I've already sent a tinkerer over to Ostall to start repairing equipment, but he's working all on his own. Could probably use a hand...and look, you've got two of them!

dialogue.name: AUTOMATON
dialogue.text: <blip> <buzz>

dialogue.name: CRAFTSDWARF03902
dialogue.text: Oh, did Regitt send you, too? Brilliant! I've plenty of arms and armor to knock back into shape, but not enough parts to mend them.

dialogue.name: CRAFTSDWARF03902
dialogue.text: I'd appreciate it if you could take these scraps and put together three repair kits for mending blades, spearheads, and the like. The automaton will cough up more materials if you need them.

dialogue.name: CRAFTSDWARF03902
dialogue.text: I'd appreciate it if you could take these cutoffs and put together three repair kits for mending hafts, scabbards, and the like. The automaton will cough up more materials if you need them.

dialogue.name: CRAFTSDWARF03902
dialogue.text: I'd appreciate it if you could take these leftover oils and put together three repair kits for greasing, polishing, and the like. The automaton will cough up more ingredients if you need them.

dialogue.name: CRAFTSDWARF03902
dialogue.text: Otherwise, you can just drop them in my lap when you're done!

dialogue.name: AUTOMATON
dialogue.text: <beep> Materials detected. Request denied.

dialogue.name: AUTOMATON
dialogue.text: <beep> Materials detected. Request denied.

dialogue.name: AUTOMATON
dialogue.text: <beep> Ingredients detected. Request denied.

dialogue.name: AUTOMATON
dialogue.text: <beep> Request for materials acknowledged.

dialogue.name: AUTOMATON
dialogue.text: <beep> Request for materials acknowledged.

dialogue.name: AUTOMATON
dialogue.text: <beep> Request for ingredients acknowledged.

dialogue.name: CRAFTSDWARF03902
dialogue.text: Lali-ho! You have those repair kits I needed?

dialogue.name: CRAFTSDWARF03902
dialogue.text: Aye, that's the stuff! ...In fact, these kits might be better quality than the gear I mean to fix!

dialogue.name: CRAFTSDWARF03902
dialogue.text: Ahem, right, I'd best get to work. You can head on back to Regitt and tell him we're holding up our side of the bargain!

dialogue.name: CRAFTSDWARF03902
dialogue.text: Thanks for the help─you've made my job a damn sight easier!

dialogue.name: REGITT
dialogue.text: Back already, are you? How fares our tinkerer?

dialogue.name: REGITT
dialogue.text: It sounds like he was well pleased with your contribution─thanks for that, Forename! We're guests in this neck of the woods, after all, and I reckon it's wise we stay on the garrison's good side.

dialogue.name: REGITT
dialogue.text: The best way we can repay their hospitality, though, is to make our tanks as good as they can be. The protection they'll give to the merchant caravans will mean one less headache for the soldiers to worry about!
